quotes.quote: When you come to a fork in the road, be still, and see with your mind's eye. There you find the clarity you seek.
When coming to the fork in the road, be cautious of the direction you choose in life.
Every major difficulty you face in life is a fork in the road. You choose which track you will head down, toward breakdown or breakthrough.
Whenever you come to a fork in the road, always choose the harder path, otherwise the path of least resistance will be chosen for you.
Every life has forks in the road. And sometimes, the tines of that fork stab deep.
At the fork in every road, choose the road that brings you nearer to God.
Do not stand before the fork in the road with indecisive decisions!
When you face a fork in the road, step on the exhilarator!
On every journey you take, you are met with options. At every fork in the road, you make a choice. These are the decisions that shape your life.
This fork in the road happens over a hundred times a day, and it's the choices that you make that will determine the shape of your life.
Impossible to know. The thing is, you take a fork in the road, it doesn't always work out for the better . . . but sometimes it does. It must.
When it comes to forks in the road, your heart always knows the answer, not your mind.
If you come to a fork in the road, take it.
You're not making a decision if you come to a fork in the road. There is no 'it' to take. It's one or the other.
With all these forks in the roads of our path, why do so many choose to take the knife?
